channel.title: Hey im new here! A few questions to help me get going :)
channel.description:
Hey evferyone, im quite new to the scar community but am realy interested and wanna get making autos now!
got a few questions to ask befor i get going tho
1- what things to jagex pick up on with SCAR i know same lenth between mose clicks and posistion but am a loss to how else they might detect you.
2- my first prog i wanna make is one that just times all my mose clicks and the spaces between them. this is so i can put human like randomness in my final script but i dnt know a timeimg function:S
lastly if andone could explane MoovMouseSmoothFromEx any better to me, it looks the best for moving move human like, or am i wrong and is they a better way
thanx to anyone spending the time to help me out, and hope i become more useful to the community in the near feature(i have BIG plans) thanx again
--=Pupp3t_Mast3r=--

item.title: Hey im new here! A few questions to help me get going :)
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

For the timing one in SRL you could use:
MarkTime(Mark);
Mouse(x,y,0,0);
TheTimeFromIt:=TimeFromMark(Mark);

Read full topic
item.source: Hey im new here! A few questions to help me get going :)

item.title: Hey im new here! A few questions to help me get going :)
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

  1. They pick up on a fast mouse and a fast click. Such as if you used clickmouse alone, that is very detectable, but if you used a procedure that would click and hold the mouse for a random amount of time, and then release the click and wait randomly again, then it would be humanlike.

  2. If you use SRL you can use their TimeRunning function and it will show you how long the script is running.

MoveMouseSmoothEx is confusing for me, but I normally put in 5s or 10s in the positions I don’t know, and later I just mess around with the numbers lol.

Here’s a funny one.

program New;
begin
  MoveMouseSmoothEx(0, 0, 0, 100, 50, 1, 10000);
end.

Read full topic
item.source: Hey im new here! A few questions to help me get going :)
